Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, interior slightly grooved, with faint traces of two lines of black-painted hieratic text on the exterior identifying the contents as western river wine.
Curator's comments: Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I. Pl. LXIV fig. 22
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393148) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393148)
